lines.text: How do you go from this tranquility to that violence?
I usually take the Ferrari.
You just got to learn to go with the heat, Rico. It's just like life. You just gotta keep telling yourself, no matter how hot it gets, sooner or later there's a cool breeze coming in.
Should I write that down?
You've got to know the rules before you can break 'em. Otherwise, it's no fun.
I get these occasional urges for stability in my life.
[During an auction]
I'm divorced and broke.
Man, it's so hot you could fry an egg on my face.
Hope I never get that hungry.
Damn, these birds are noisy. At least they're not in a cage, sort of a natural habitat.
Kind of like an alligator in a sailboat.
People in stucco houses shouldn't throw quiche.
These days money comes from all kinds of places.
Yeah, well, my money comes from my pocket. Now do you wanna do business?
You know what they say about architecture, it's like frozen music.
All I know about you is that you drive a Testarossa and you live on a boat.
First a junkie, now a hooker. I think I've been in the business too long, I'm starting to fall for the players.

[to lawyer]
What did you do, trade in your conscience when you passed the bar?
Knowing the answers doesn't make it any easier, does it?
In this job you're lucky if it doesn't make it any harder.
It's like taking nose candy off a baby.
In this life the low road sometimes takes you a more interesting route.
Do you think this makes us even?
No, not at all. Is was just the best I had to offer.
Aw, the hell with it. You want to be dead? Bang, you're dead.

[During heat a wave]
Man, I can dig tropical, but this is out of bounds.
Your partner looks kinda intense today.
I haven't seen him like this since 1983 when he chased a guy who stole a hubcap from the bug van.
Have we already had the scene where I ask what this is all about and you say, "Shut up, we ask the questions".
I don't know, did we, Lar?

[Describing his ex-wife]
She left me at Sears, and had me cryin' all the way to Walgreens.
If Miami hasn't got it, they haven't invented it yet.
I don't believe you for a New York minute.
I wonder what the price of silence is in Haiti.
To what do I owe this pleasure?
I wanted to see how you chill out after a rape.
Hate waiting, feel like a character in a Becket play.
Since when do you know Becket?
Charlie Becket, works down the shoeshine, writes plays on the side.
This is America, you need to be in debt, only way banks can get money back.
I thought we were going to have a meaningful diabolical time.
Nice to know there's still a little poetry left in the world.
Do you think that guy practices at being a tubesteak?
You know what I like about you, Rickles? Not a damn thing - backstroke.
Hey, handsome, why don't you buy me a drink?
Because I wasn't born yesterday.
[at shooting range]
New Bren-10's pretty nice, ey Burnett?
It's all right.
Got the Eagle inside, you want to try it?
Some other time, Kern.
Haven't seen you in a while.
Been pretty busy.
Still keeping in touch with the Cazadores?
That bunch of daisies?
[laughs scornfully]
I'm putting together a whole new group of people. Men that take life seriously.
[pause]

200 miles out there, there's men sitting in nuclear submarines just waiting to put us in their crosshairs. Who's gonna protect us, mister? The Army? They're a bunch of toy soldiers. Half-breds! Women! Homosexuals! That's who is protecting our country!
